Project Title: Can We Reduce N and Improve ROI?
Notes: 2017: soybeans, no-till; 2018: corn, no-till, rye crop seeded in fall; 2019: rye crop, millet+sorghum-sudan+oat cover crop mix after rye cut and baled; 2020: corn in 60-in. rows with grass+legume mix interseeded V5; 2021: soybeans, no-till, rye cover crop in fall

Project Title: Can We Reduce N and Improve ROI?
Notes: Both trts: 3500 gallons/acre of liquid hog manure injected early May. Analysis revealed 54.3 lb N/1,000 gal. Total units N applied = 190 lb N/ac

Notes: That's pretty great news that the yields were that close and there was no statistically significant difference! Certainly doesn't make sense to be sidedressing on top of manure application with those results, and we'll be changing our program next year based on what we've found this year
